action.action-desc: Mr. Heinrich (for himself and Mr. Vitter) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To provide for proper reimbursement of the Department of Defense for assistance provided to nongovernmental entertainment-oriented media producers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Military Equitable Reimbursement Act of 2013.

section.header: Reimbursement of Department of Defense for assistance provided to nongovernmental entertainment-oriented media producers

paragraph.text: The Department of Defense benefits when the entertainment industry produces media portraying the skill, heroism, capability, and challenges of members of the Armed Forces and their families through increased morale, better recruitment and retention, and improved understanding by the public.
The Department of Defense is in often the best position to ensure realism in productions.
The Department of Defense is sometimes forced to decline assisting in productions because expenses incurred are not reimbursed to the accounts withdrawn.
Subchapter II of chapter 134 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 2263 the following new section:

section.header: Reimbursement for assistance provided to nongovernmental entertainment-oriented media producers

subsection.text: There shall be credited to the applicable appropriations account or fund from which the expenses described in subsection (b) were charged any amounts received by the Department of Defense as reimbursement for such expenses.
The expenses referred to in subsection (a) are any expensesâ€”

paragraph.text: for which the Department of Defense requires reimbursement under section 9701 of title 31, United States Code, or any other provision of law; and
for which the Department of Defense received reimbursement after the date of the enactment of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2014.
The table of sections at the beginning of such subchapter is amended by adding after the item relating to section 2263 the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 2264. Reimbursement for assistance provided to nongovernmental entertainment-oriented media producers.
